content.title: Funeral Financial Assistant (APB&OCWWB)
content.department: Department of Labour and Employment, Government of Arunachal Pradesh
content.details: The scheme “Funeral Financial Assistant” was started by the Department of Labour and Employment, Govt. of Arunachal Pradesh for registered workers of Arunachal Pradesh Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (APB&OCWWB). The state government has proposed and implemented this scheme through the APB&OCWWB for providing financial assistance to the families upon the death of the registered worker for his/her funeral.
benefits: Cash assistance of ₹1000/- only to the nominee of the deceased worker at the time of sanctioning the death benefit amount.
eligibility: The applicant should be a permanent resident of Arunachal Pradesh.
The applicant should be a family member of a deceased worker who was employed in the Building and Other Construction works.
The deceased worker should be registered with Labour Welfare Board (APB&OCWWB).
The deceased worker should have an active membership at the time of death.
The name of the nominee/ dependent should be recorded on his/her registration card before death.
content.application_process: Offline. The applicant needs to contact Registering Officers, APB&OCWWB of the respective District. The applicant should have all the relevant documents before going to the concerned office. After successful verification, the applicant can avail the benefit of the scheme.
documents_required: Identity proof i.e. Aadhaar Card, Voter ID card, etc.
Original copy of the registration card of the worker
Bank Account number/ front page of the passbook

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The objective of this scheme is to provide financial assistance upon the death of the registered worker for his/her funeral.

faqs.question: By which department was this scheme launched?
faqs.answer: Department of Labour and Employment, Government of Arunachal Pradesh.

faqs.question: What is the full form of APB&OCWWB?
faqs.answer: Arunachal Pradesh Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board.

faqs.question: How much cash assistance will be given to the nominee?
faqs.answer: Cash assistance of ₹1000/- only to the nominee of the deceased worker at the time of sanctioning the death benefit amount.

faqs.question: Who is eligible under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The nominee of the deceased worker who was a registered worker under APB&OCWWB is eligible to take benefit of the scheme.

faqs.question: Was it mandatory to have registered under Board?
faqs.answer: Yes, the labourer/worker must be a registered worker under the Board.

faqs.question: Can an individual also apply for the scheme if membership of worker/ labour was expired before death?
faqs.answer: No, the worker’s membership shall be active at the time of death.

faqs.question: Is it necessary for the nominee to have his/her name on the registration card of the deceased worker?
faqs.answer: Yes, the name of the nominee/dependant should be recorded on the deceased worker’s registration card before death.

faqs.question: How can I avail the benefits of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The applicant needs to contact Registering Officers, APB&OCWWB of the respective District.
